title: Boston residents say they feel safer downtown compared to last year in new survey
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: A survey by Downtown Boston Neighborhood Association shows decreased feelings of unsafety, from 70.6% in 2024 to 33.7% now.
The Downtown Boston Public Safety Summit discussed issues like drug use, petty crime, and infrastructure, highlighting improvements in public safety.
Retail vacancies in downtown Boston are at their lowest since the COVID-19 pandemic, linked to increased feelings of safety.

title: Patriots vs. Falcons live updates: Can Patriots extend win streak to six games?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The New England Patriots (6-2) host the Atlanta Falcons (3-4) at Gillette Stadium, looking for a sixth consecutive win.
Rhamondre Stevenson is inactive due to a toe injury, potentially leading to more game time for TreVeyon Henderson.
The Falcons have the NFL's top-ranked pass defense, allowing just 149.1 passing yards per game this season.

title: 10 defendants, including a grandma, indicted in statewide sex trafficking case
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Ten defendants indicted for statewide sex trafficking involving multiple women across Essex, Middlesex, Plymouth, and Suffolk counties.
Gianni Martinez, 23, of Lynn, allegedly trafficked women and coordinated online profiles, seeking to recruit additional victims.
Investigators seized phones revealing evidence against alleged buyers, including five men charged with paying for sexual conduct.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Miles Teller hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Miles Teller hosted the fourth episode of SNL's 51st season, returning after a one-week hiatus.
Brandi Carlile was the musical guest, marking her fourth appearance, previously performing with Elton John.
Teller participated in a mock NYC mayoral debate during the political cold open alongside other recent SNL hosts.

title: Regulators are limiting a proposed Eversource rate hike in Mass.
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: The Massachusetts Department of Public Utilities rejected parts of Eversource's gas rate hike request, saving customers $45 million.
Eversource's proposed rate hikes would have increased NSTAR division customer bills by 13% to 17% this winter.
Gov. Maura Healey criticized the proposed hikes, saying more efforts are needed to reduce Massachusetts families' heating costs.

title: Wayland schools investigating after Black student targeted in racist locker room incident
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Wayland High School investigates racist locker room incident involving a Black student's jersey hung on a street safety figure.
Principal Allyson Mizoguchi condemns the act, stating it has caused community-wide pain and emphasizes educational efforts against racism.
Wayland Police and the Middlesex DA are coordinating an investigation, with community discussions planned to address impacts.

title: Kevin Durant, Rockets pummel exhausted Celtics to snap three-game winning streak: 6 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: The Houston Rockets defeated the Boston Celtics 128-101, ending Boston's three-game winning streak.
Kevin Durant led the Rockets with 26 points as they took advantage of the Celtics' rigorous schedule.
Baylor Scheierman led the Celtics with 17 points, showing promise on offense and defense.

title: Patriots elevate veteran RB D’Ernest Johnson ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Falcons
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Patriots elevate D'Ernest Johnson from practice squad to active roster for Sunday's game against the Falcons.
Rhamondre Stevenson's toe injury and Antonio Gibson's ACL injury leave Patriots' running back depth thin.
D'Ernest Johnson, a seven-year NFL veteran, could contribute both offensively and on special teams for New England.

title: A new partnership between McAvoy, Zadorov has Bruins defense regaining some bite
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Charlie McAvoy and Nikita Zadorov have strengthened the Bruins' defense, resulting in three consecutive wins.
Zadorov's physical play complements McAvoy's offensive skill, forming a solid top defensive pairing for the Bruins.
The Bruins have improved defensively, allowing only one 5-on-5 goal in 73:24 of McAvoy-Zadorov ice time.

title: How Jeremy Swayman responded after tweak in Bruins goalie rotation
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jeremy Swayman allowed only one goal in a 2-1 win over the Carolina Hurricanes after adjustments in the Bruins' goalie rotation.
Joonas Korpisalo started two consecutive games, performing well with a .933 save percentage in victories against the Islanders and Sabres.
Despite a poor performance against Ottawa, Swayman maintains a higher save percentage and goals saved above expected than Korpisalo.
